alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 20 at 11:54AM MST until December 21 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Moderate to heavy snow expected with blowing and drifting snow from high wind. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches, except 6 to 12 inches on ridge tops and elevations above passes. Winds gusting as high as 50 to 60 mph. * WHERE...Emigration Summit...Wasatch Mountains in Idaho. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning and evening commute. Strong winds could cause tree damage. The cold wind chills as low as 25 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions and closures can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or going to 511.idaho.gov.
